meanings.definition: To cause or allow (liquid) to flow over the edge of its container, especially by accident.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 使（液体）从容器中流出，尤指意外地

examples.english: She accidentally spilled coffee on her new dress.
examples.chinese: 她不小心把咖啡洒在了她的新裙子上。

meanings.definition: To reveal information that should be kept secret.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 泄露本应保密的信息

examples.english: He finally spilled the details about the surprise party.
examples.chinese: 他最终透露了有关惊喜派对的细节。

meanings.definition: An instance of liquid flowing over the edge of a container.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 液体从容器边缘溢出的情况

examples.english: There was a spill on aisle five that needed to be cleaned up.
examples.chinese: 五号过道有一滩溢出物需要清理。

meanings.definition: Of only average or fairly low quality; not very good.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 质量一般或相当低的；不太好的

examples.english: The restaurant received mediocre reviews from food critics.
examples.chinese: 这家餐厅收到了美食评论家一般性的评价。

meanings.definition: Not satisfactory; below an acceptable level.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 不令人满意的；低于可接受水平的

examples.english: His mediocre performance in the exam disappointed his teachers.
examples.chinese: 他在考试中平庸的表现让他的老师们感到失望。

meanings.definition: To guide or direct someone or something along a way.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 引导或指导某人或某物沿着某条路线

examples.english: The tour guide led us through the ancient ruins.
examples.chinese: 导游带领我们参观了古代遗迹。

meanings.definition: To be in charge or command of.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 负责或指挥

examples.english: She leads a team of researchers at the university.
examples.chinese: 她在大学里领导着一个研究团队。

meanings.definition: A position of advantage; first place.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 优势地位；第一名

examples.english: The runner maintained his lead throughout the race.
examples.chinese: 这位跑步者在整个比赛中保持了领先优势。

meanings.definition: A soft, heavy, bluish-gray metal (chemical element with symbol Pb).
meanings.chineseDefinition: 一种柔软、重、蓝灰色的金属（化学元素，符号为Pb）

examples.english: Lead was commonly used in plumbing until it was found to be toxic.
examples.chinese: 铅在被发现有毒之前常用于水管制造。

meanings.definition: To state or explain precisely the nature, scope, or meaning of something.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 准确地陈述或解释某事物的性质、范围或含义

examples.english: The professor asked the students to define the term 'democracy'.
examples.chinese: 教授要求学生定义"民主"这个术语。

meanings.definition: To mark out the boundary or limits of something.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 标出某物的边界或限制

examples.english: The fence defines the property line between the two houses.
examples.chinese: 这个围栏界定了两座房子之间的产权线。

meanings.definition: To make clear or distinct.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 使清晰或明显

examples.english: High-definition television defines images more clearly than standard TV.
examples.chinese: 高清电视比标准电视更清晰地呈现图像。

meanings.definition: A number, especially one that forms part of official statistics or relates to the financial performance of a company.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 数字，尤指构成官方统计数据的一部分或与公司财务业绩相关的数字

examples.english: The latest unemployment figures show a slight decrease.
examples.chinese: 最新的失业数字显示略有下降。

meanings.definition: The form or shape of a person or thing.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 人或物的形状或外形

examples.english: She had a slender figure that was perfect for modeling.
examples.chinese: 她有一个适合做模特的苗条身材。

meanings.definition: A person of a specified kind, typically one who is important or distinctive in some way.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 特定类型的人，通常是在某些方面重要或独特的人

examples.english: He was a leading figure in the civil rights movement.
examples.chinese: 他是民权运动中的领军人物。

meanings.definition: To calculate or work out (an amount or value).
meanings.chineseDefinition: 计算或算出（数量或价值）

examples.english: I need to figure how much paint we'll need for the project.
examples.chinese: 我需要计算一下这个项目需要多少油漆。

meanings.definition: To be an important or noticeable part of something; to appear or be mentioned.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 成为某事物的重要或显著部分；出现或被提及

examples.english: The economy figures prominently in the election campaign.
examples.chinese: 经济在选举活动中占有突出地位。

meanings.definition: Producing or able to produce large amounts of goods, crops, or other commodities.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 生产或能够生产大量商品、农作物或其他产品

examples.english: The new farming methods have made the land more productive.
examples.chinese: 新的耕作方法使土地更有生产力。

meanings.definition: Achieving or producing a significant amount or result.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 取得或产生大量或显著成果

examples.english: We had a very productive meeting and resolved all the outstanding issues.
examples.chinese: 我们进行了一次非常富有成效的会议，解决了所有悬而未决的问题。

meanings.definition: Relating to the production of goods and services.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 与商品和服务的生产有关

examples.english: The company invested in productive capacity to meet growing demand.
examples.chinese: 该公司投资于生产能力以满足不断增长的需求。

meanings.definition: To say or do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 对已经说过或做过的事情作出反应

examples.english: She didn't respond to my email until three days later.
examples.chinese: 她直到三天后才回复我的电子邮件。

meanings.definition: To react quickly or positively to a stimulus or treatment.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 对刺激或治疗迅速或积极地作出反应

examples.english: The patient responded well to the new medication.
examples.chinese: 患者对新药反应良好。

meanings.definition: To take action as a result of something.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 因某事而采取行动

examples.english: Emergency services responded immediately to the fire alarm.
examples.chinese: 紧急服务部门立即对火警作出反应。

meanings.definition: The action of officially agreeing to something or accepting something as satisfactory.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 正式同意某事或接受某事为满意的行为

examples.english: The project cannot proceed without the approval of the committee.
examples.chinese: 没有委员会的批准，该项目不能进行。

meanings.definition: The belief that someone or something is good or acceptable.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 认为某人或某事物是好的或可接受的信念

examples.english: She nodded in approval at his suggestion.
examples.chinese: 她点头表示赞同他的建议。

meanings.definition: To perceive or detect the odor or scent of something through the nose.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 通过鼻子感知或检测某物的气味

examples.english: I can smell fresh bread baking in the kitchen.
examples.chinese: 我能闻到厨房里正在烤制的新鲜面包的香味。

meanings.definition: To emit an odor that can be perceived by the sense of smell.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 发出可以通过嗅觉感知的气味

examples.english: The roses smell wonderful in the garden.
examples.chinese: 花园里的玫瑰散发出美妙的香气。

meanings.definition: The faculty or power of perceiving odors or scents by means of the organs in the nose.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 通过鼻子中的器官感知气味的能力

examples.english: Dogs have a much better sense of smell than humans.
examples.chinese: 狗的嗅觉比人类好得多。

meanings.definition: A distinctive odor, especially an unpleasant one.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 独特的气味，尤指不愉快的气味

examples.english: There was a strange smell coming from the basement.
examples.chinese: 地下室里有一股奇怪的气味。

meanings.definition: A fault, imperfection, or weakness that mars an otherwise good thing.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 损坏原本良好事物的缺点、瑕疵或弱点

examples.english: The diamond had a small flaw that reduced its value.
examples.chinese: 这颗钻石有一个小瑕疵，降低了它的价值。

meanings.definition: A mistake or error in reasoning that makes an argument invalid.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 使论点无效的推理错误

examples.english: There's a fundamental flaw in your argument.
examples.chinese: 你的论点存在一个根本性的缺陷。

meanings.definition: To damage or make imperfect.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 损坏或使不完美

examples.english: The scandal flawed his reputation permanently.
examples.chinese: 这起丑闻永久地损害了他的声誉。

meanings.definition: Having or involving several parts, elements, or factors.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 有或涉及多个部分、元素或因素

examples.english: The patient suffered multiple injuries in the accident.
examples.chinese: 患者在事故中受了多处伤。

meanings.definition: A number that can be divided by another number without a remainder.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 可以被另一个数字整除的数

examples.english: 12 is a multiple of both 3 and 4.
examples.chinese: 12是3和4的倍数。

meanings.definition: A person or thing that has several different elements or forms.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 具有多种不同元素或形式的人或物

examples.english: The artist works in multiples, creating several identical prints of each design.
examples.chinese: 这位艺术家创作多件作品，为每个设计制作几个相同的版画。

meanings.definition: An unusual and exciting or daring experience.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 不寻常且令人兴奋或大胆的经历

examples.english: Their safari in Africa was the adventure of a lifetime.
examples.chinese: 他们在非洲的狩猎之旅是一生中最精彩的冒险。

meanings.definition: Excitement associated with danger or the taking of risks.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 与危险或冒险相关的刺激

examples.english: He loved the adventure of rock climbing.
examples.chinese: 他喜欢攀岩的冒险刺激。

meanings.definition: To engage in daring or risky activity.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 参与大胆或冒险的活动

examples.english: They adventured into the unexplored jungle.
examples.chinese: 他们冒险进入了未被探索的丛林。

meanings.definition: An area or stretch of land having a particular characteristic, purpose, or use, or subject to particular restrictions.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 具有特定特征、用途或用途的区域或土地，或受特定限制的区域

examples.english: The city has designated certain zones for commercial development.
examples.chinese: 该市已指定某些区域用于商业开发。

meanings.definition: A section of an area or territory established for a specific purpose.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 为特定目的而设立的区域或领土的一部分

examples.english: The school playground is divided into zones for different activities.
examples.chinese: 学校操场被划分为不同活动的区域。

meanings.definition: To divide an area into zones for specific uses.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 将一个区域划分为特定用途的区域

examples.english: The city council zoned the area for residential use only.
examples.chinese: 市议会将该区域划为仅供住宅使用。

meanings.definition: A simplified drawing showing the appearance, structure, or workings of something; a schematic representation.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 显示某物外观、结构或工作原理的简化图；示意图

examples.english: The textbook included a diagram of the human circulatory system.
examples.chinese: 教科书中包含了人体循环系统的图解。

meanings.definition: A plan, sketch, drawing, or outline designed to demonstrate or explain how something works or to clarify the relationship between the parts of a whole.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 旨在演示或解释某物如何工作或阐明整体各部分之间关系的计划、草图、图纸或轮廓

examples.english: The engineer drew a detailed diagram of the new engine design.
examples.chinese: 工程师绘制了新引擎设计的详细图表。

meanings.definition: To represent or explain something in the form of a diagram.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 以图表形式表示或解释某事

examples.english: The teacher diagrammed the sentence on the blackboard.
examples.chinese: 老师在黑板上画出了这个句子的结构图。

meanings.definition: Not cooked or processed.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 未烹饪或未加工的

examples.english: She prefers to eat raw vegetables in her salad.
examples.chinese: 她喜欢在沙拉中吃生蔬菜。

meanings.definition: In its natural state; not yet processed or refined for use.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 处于自然状态；尚未加工或精炼以供使用

examples.english: The factory imports raw materials from several countries.
examples.chinese: 这家工厂从几个国家进口原材料。

meanings.definition: (of a wound or skin) red and painful, especially through being rubbed or having the skin broken.
meanings.chineseDefinition: （伤口或皮肤）红肿疼痛的，尤指因摩擦或皮肤破损

examples.english: His hands were raw from working in the garden without gloves.
examples.chinese: 他因为不戴手套在花园里工作，手都磨破了。

meanings.definition: Frank and realistic in the depiction of unpleasant facts or situations.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在描述不愉快的事实或情况时坦率和现实

examples.english: The documentary presented a raw account of life in prison.
examples.chinese: 这部纪录片真实地展现了监狱生活。

meanings.definition: To stand, move, or sit in a lazy, drooping way.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 以懒散、下垂的方式站立、移动或坐着

examples.english: Don't slouch in your chair during the interview.
examples.chinese: 面试时不要在椅子上懒散地坐着。

meanings.definition: A lazy, drooping posture or gait.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 懒散、下垂的姿势或步态

examples.english: He walked with a slouch that suggested fatigue or boredom.
examples.chinese: 他走路时弯腰驼背，表明他疲惫或厌烦。

meanings.definition: An incompetent or lazy person.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 无能或懒惰的人

examples.english: He's no slouch when it comes to programming.
examples.chinese: 说到编程，他可不是个无能之辈。

meanings.definition: A flower, especially one cultivated for its beauty.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 花，尤指为其美丽而栽培的花

examples.english: The garden was filled with colorful blooms in spring.
examples.chinese: 春天，花园里满是色彩缤纷的花朵。

meanings.definition: The state or period of flowering.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 开花的状态或时期

examples.english: The cherry trees are in bloom all over the city.
examples.chinese: 樱桃树在整个城市都开花了。

meanings.definition: A youthful or healthy glow in a person's complexion.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 人面色中的青春或健康光彩

examples.english: There was a healthy bloom in her cheeks after the walk.
examples.chinese: 散步后，她的脸颊呈现出健康的红润。

meanings.definition: To produce flowers; to blossom.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 开花；绽放

examples.english: The roses bloom in June and July.
examples.chinese: 玫瑰在六月和七月开花。

meanings.definition: To mature into or be in a state of healthy, vigorous, or successful development.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 成熟为或处于健康、充满活力或成功发展的状态

examples.english: Their friendship bloomed into romance.
examples.chinese: 他们的友谊发展成了爱情。

meanings.definition: The line at which the earth's surface and the sky appear to meet.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 地球表面与天空看似相接的线

examples.english: The sun dipped below the horizon, casting a red glow across the sky.
examples.chinese: 太阳沉入地平线以下，在天空中投下红色的光芒。

meanings.definition: The limit of a person's knowledge, experience, or interest.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 一个人的知识、经验或兴趣的界限

examples.english: Travel broadens your horizons and gives you new perspectives.
examples.chinese: 旅行拓宽你的视野，给你新的观点。

meanings.definition: The boundary of a person's mental outlook, especially as influenced by education, experience, and prejudice.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 一个人的精神视野的边界，尤其是受教育、经验和偏见影响的

examples.english: Reading widely can expand your intellectual horizons.
examples.chinese: 广泛阅读可以扩展你的知识视野。

meanings.definition: A cunning or skillful act or scheme intended to deceive or outwit someone.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 旨在欺骗或智胜某人的狡猾或巧妙的行为或计谋

examples.english: The con artist used an elaborate trick to steal money from elderly people.
examples.chinese: 这个骗子使用了一个精心设计的把戏从老年人那里偷钱。

meanings.definition: A skillful act performed for entertainment or amusement.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 为娱乐或消遣而表演的技巧性动作

examples.english: The magician performed several amazing card tricks.
examples.chinese: 魔术师表演了几个令人惊叹的纸牌魔术。

meanings.definition: A peculiar or characteristic habit or mannerism.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 特殊或特征性的习惯或怪癖

examples.english: She has this trick of raising her eyebrow when she's skeptical.
examples.chinese: 她有一个习惯，就是在怀疑时挑眉。

meanings.definition: To deceive or outwit (someone) by cunning or ingenuity.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 通过狡猾或聪明才智欺骗或智胜（某人）

examples.english: He tricked me into revealing my password.
examples.chinese: 他骗我透露了我的密码。

meanings.definition: Designed to deceive or create an illusion.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 旨在欺骗或制造幻觉的

examples.english: The room featured trick lighting to make it appear larger.
examples.chinese: 房间采用了特殊照明，使其看起来更大。

meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a scale of temperature in which water freezes at 0° and boils at 100° under standard conditions.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 与温度刻度有关或表示温度刻度，在该刻度中，在标准条件下水在0°冻结，在100°沸腾

examples.english: The weather forecast predicted temperatures of 25 degrees centigrade.
examples.chinese: 天气预报预测气温为25摄氏度。

meanings.definition: The centigrade (Celsius) scale of temperature.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 摄氏温度刻度

examples.english: Most countries use centigrade rather than Fahrenheit.
examples.chinese: 大多数国家使用摄氏度而不是华氏度。

meanings.definition: Not deterred by danger or pain; brave.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 不被危险或痛苦吓倒；勇敢的

examples.english: The courageous firefighter ran into the burning building to save the child.
examples.chinese: 勇敢的消防员冲进燃烧的大楼救出孩子。

meanings.definition: Showing mental or moral strength to withstand danger, fear, or difficulty.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 表现出抵御危险、恐惧或困难的精神或道德力量

examples.english: It was courageous of her to speak out against corruption despite the threats.
examples.chinese: 尽管受到威胁，她仍敢于发声反对腐败，这很勇敢。

meanings.definition: To the same degree or amount.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 达到相同程度或数量

examples.english: The project wasn't as difficult as we expected.
examples.chinese: 这个项目不像我们预期的那么困难。

meanings.definition: Used in comparisons to refer to the extent or degree of something.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在比较中用来指某事物的程度或等级

examples.english: She's twice as tall as her younger sister.
examples.chinese: 她比她妹妹高两倍。

meanings.definition: During the time when; while.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在...的时候；当...时

examples.english: We watched the sunset as we ate dinner.
examples.chinese: 我们一边吃晚餐一边看日落。

meanings.definition: Because; since.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 因为；由于

examples.english: As it was raining, we decided to stay indoors.
examples.chinese: 因为下雨，我们决定待在室内。

meanings.definition: In the role, capacity, or function of.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 作为...的角色、能力或功能

examples.english: She works as a doctor at the local hospital.
examples.chinese: 她在当地医院担任医生。

meanings.definition: Relating to education and scholarship.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 与教育和学术有关的

examples.english: The university offers a wide range of academic courses.
examples.chinese: 这所大学提供各种学术课程。

meanings.definition: Relating to an educational institution, especially a school of higher learning.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 与教育机构有关的，尤指高等学府

examples.english: The academic year begins in September.
examples.chinese: 学年从九月开始。

meanings.definition: Not of practical relevance; of only theoretical interest.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 不具有实际相关性；仅具理论兴趣的

examples.english: The debate has become purely academic since the project was canceled.
examples.chinese: 自从项目被取消后，这场辩论已经变得纯粹是学术性的了。

meanings.definition: A teacher or scholar in a university or other institute of higher education.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 大学或其他高等教育机构的教师或学者

examples.english: The conference brought together academics from around the world.
examples.chinese: 这次会议汇集了来自世界各地的学者。

meanings.definition: More desirable or suitable; to be preferred.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 更理想或更合适的；更值得选择的

examples.english: Taking the train is preferable to driving in heavy traffic.
examples.chinese: 乘火车比在拥堵的交通中开车更可取。

meanings.definition: Worthy of being preferred; more desirable than another.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 值得被优先选择的；比另一个更令人向往的

examples.english: A peaceful solution is always preferable to conflict.
examples.chinese: 和平解决方案总是比冲突更可取。

meanings.definition: The measurement and statistical analysis of people's unique physical and behavioral characteristics, especially for identification and access control.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 对人们独特的身体和行为特征进行测量和统计分析，尤其用于身份识别和访问控制

examples.english: The company uses fingerprint biometrics to secure access to sensitive areas.
examples.chinese: 该公司使用指纹生物识别技术来保护敏感区域的访问安全。

meanings.definition: The application of statistical analysis to biological data.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 将统计分析应用于生物数据

examples.english: Biometrics plays a crucial role in modern medical research.
examples.chinese: 生物统计学在现代医学研究中扮演着至关重要的角色。

meanings.definition: The technologies that measure and analyze human body characteristics, such as fingerprints, eye retinas and irises, voice patterns, facial patterns, and hand measurements.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 测量和分析人体特征的技术，如指纹、眼睛视网膜和虹膜、声音模式、面部模式和手部测量

examples.english: Facial recognition is one of the most widely used biometrics technologies today.
examples.chinese: 面部识别是当今最广泛使用的生物识别技术之一。

meanings.definition: To bring (people) together again after a period of separation or disunity.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在一段分离或不和之后再次将（人们）聚集在一起

examples.english: The program helps to reunite families separated by war.
examples.chinese: 该计划帮助因战争而分离的家庭团聚。

meanings.definition: To come together again after a period of separation.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 在一段分离期后再次聚在一起

examples.english: The band plans to reunite for a special anniversary concert.
examples.chinese: 这个乐队计划为特别周年纪念音乐会重聚。

meanings.definition: The smaller number or part, especially a number that is less than half the whole number.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 较小的数量或部分，尤指少于总数一半的数量

examples.english: Only a minority of students passed the difficult exam.
examples.chinese: 只有少数学生通过了这个困难的考试。

meanings.definition: A racial, ethnic, religious, or social subdivision of a society that is subordinate to the dominant group in political, financial, or social power without regard to the size of these groups.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 社会中的种族、民族、宗教或社会分支，在政治、经济或社会权力方面从属于主导群体，而不考虑这些群体的规模

examples.english: The government has introduced new policies to protect the rights of ethnic minorities.
examples.chinese: 政府推出了新政策，保护少数民族的权利。

meanings.definition: The state or period of being under the age of full legal responsibility.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 未达到完全法律责任年龄的状态或时期

examples.english: He remained under the guardianship of his parents during his minority.
examples.chinese: 在他未成年期间，他一直在父母的监护下。

meanings.definition: To close (something, especially the hand or teeth) tightly.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 紧紧地闭合（某物，尤其是手或牙齿）

examples.english: She clenched her fists in anger.
examples.chinese: 她愤怒地紧握拳头。

meanings.definition: To hold (something) tightly or firmly.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 紧紧或牢牢地握住（某物）

examples.english: He clenched the letter in his hand as he read the bad news.
examples.chinese: 他在读这个坏消息时，紧紧地握着这封信。

meanings.definition: The act of clenching or the state of being clenched.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 紧握的动作或被紧握的状态

examples.english: The clench of his jaw showed his determination.
examples.chinese: 他紧咬下巴显示出他的决心。

meanings.definition: A collection of written texts, especially the entire works of a particular author or a body of writing on a particular subject.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 书面文本的集合，尤指特定作者的全部作品或关于特定主题的一系列著作

examples.english: Researchers analyzed the entire corpus of Shakespeare's works.
examples.chinese: 研究人员分析了莎士比亚作品的全部文集。

meanings.definition: A large and structured set of texts used for linguistic analysis.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 用于语言分析的大型结构化文本集

examples.english: The linguists compiled a corpus of spoken English for their research.
examples.chinese: 语言学家为他们的研究编制了一个口语英语语料库。

meanings.definition: The main body or mass of a structure.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 结构的主体或主要部分

examples.english: The corpus of the building was constructed in the 18th century.
examples.chinese: 这座建筑的主体是在18世纪建造的。

meanings.definition: A warning of danger, typically a loud noise or signal.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 危险警告，通常是大声的噪音或信号

examples.english: The fire alarm went off in the middle of the night.
examples.chinese: 半夜时火警警报响了起来。

meanings.definition: An electronic device that makes a loud noise or other signal to warn of danger.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 发出大声噪音或其他信号以警告危险的电子设备

examples.english: They installed a burglar alarm in their new house.
examples.chinese: 他们在新房子里安装了防盗警报器。

meanings.definition: A clock or watch with a mechanism that can be set to go off at a particular time.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 带有可设定在特定时间响起的机制的时钟或手表

examples.english: I set my alarm for 6 AM every weekday.
examples.chinese: 我每个工作日都把闹钟设定在早上6点。

meanings.definition: Anxiety or fear caused by the expectation or realization of danger.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 由危险的预期或认识引起的焦虑或恐惧

examples.english: The news report caused alarm among local residents.
examples.chinese: 这则新闻报道引起了当地居民的恐慌。

meanings.definition: To make (someone) feel frightened, disturbed, or in danger.
meanings.chineseDefinition: 使（某人）感到害怕、不安或处于危险中

examples.english: The sudden noise alarmed the sleeping baby.
examples.chinese: 突然的噪音惊吓了熟睡的婴儿。
